review: I bought my sister an AppleTV and bought my ex-girlfriend a Roku (3rd edition).  Both were decent at what they did, but this device works even better for my use-case.  Two of these still cost less than one of the others I mentioned while delivering comparable performance.  After a quick on-screen configuration (which was facilitated by my phone's Chromecast app) I had them both working.I rate the device a 5, but Google's tech support is somewhat lacking with the device.  I had two issues:1)  I had to search for a bit to find out that the device only supports the 2.4GHz wireless band.  After re-enabling it on my router (I was set up for 5GHz only in my house) I had them connect successfully.2)  After a reset I could see the devices for about 1 minute, after which I couldn't communicate with them anymore on my phone.  They were both on and showing as connected to the router but I couldn't see them.  After much internet searching I found an article mentioning that these devices use uPnP/Multicast to communicate with other devices.  I reconfigured my router to allow uPnP and they started showing up as expected.  Still, it was exceedingly confusing and the provided documentation made no mention of this (that I could find.)
